data.title: Come Hungry!
data.text: This is a great restaurant when you're REALLY hungry!  All the meals are served "family style" with a great big bowl of soup, pinto beans, salad, fries and potatoes au gratin to share!  We love the petite cut ribeye, which is actually much bigger than the supposed 8 oz.!  The garlic sauce is great on top.  Be sure to try the "tongue" appetizer, which is thinly sliced pieces of beef tongue, marinated and served with fresh tomatoes and cheese.  Very reasonable prices!

data.title: Great Basque culinary experience
data.text: Long time Basque restaurant. There is a regular dining room and for a great lunchtime (also for dinner)experience call a reserve a place or places at the boarder's table. Two long tables for lunch and a large room with long tables for dinner. The dinner 'bell' rings at noon and everyone files in with no spaces between people. There are different menus for Tues.,Wed.,Thurs. and Fri. I was there with clients on a Wed.. Then they bring in the food in large plates and bowls for the folks to serve themselves from. First a great salad, then the soup of the day, then a very tasty dish of homemade basque sausage with red beans and finally fried chicken. Local wine and small glasses are placed along the table. Call to ask what the menu is for the day for the boarders table.

data.title: Hearty Comfort Food
data.text: Hearty comfort food and lots of it. Starting with soup and ending with flan, everything was excellent.  They have a unique sausage that they make in-house, lukina that doesn't disappoint. Also loved the veal roast and lamb shanks. We will return!

data.title: Soup
data.text: Best potato leek soup around. We love to go on potato leek soup day.  It is served with sourdough bread and real butter.  Yum!

data.title: That back room is just so fun
data.text: Wholesome food, plenty of it and the fun of the long table out back is wonderful. The front bar is welcoming and the atmosphere and ambience is friendly. Parking is plentiful.

data.title: Great Music and fine Dining
data.text: Great atmosphere and music and food. I went with friends to hear a band that was playing. Although I didn't have dinner we ordered light food to snack on and the prices were reasonable. Our servers were very friendly and quick to bring our orders.

data.title: Return visit
data.text:
A family friend always eats here and we visited the restaurant 20 years ago on his recommendations. We were  not disappointed then or this April. With some knowledge of the Basque people we looked forward to meeting up here again.When we said we knew St Jean pm Porte and the village of Ispoure and mentioned the family name it stimulated a super reaction - Monique Berterretche came down to meet us and we talked in French about the family.Small world!
    Food wise simple ,generous and delicious with no sophisticated edges.In family to the best way to describe it is great Basque family food.Worth the trip with wonderful friendly Basque people.Bravo

data.title: A Unique Place
data.text: We have been coming here for years at the Boarders Table - good plentiful food and great people.  This time we decided to try the dining room in the back as we were there too late for the family style meal.  The soup was excellent - and hot - a perfect choice for a cold wet day.  We both tried versions of their sausage - very tasty,  The portions were ample, prices were reasonable and the service was great/

data.title: Not as good as it use to be
data.text: When I was younger I use to go here, now I went back on a return visit, not impressed, lamb was way over cooked, small amount of the main course, prime rib was marginal, atmosphere  was poor.  will not return

data.title: Homey
data.text:
Solid, home-like food.  Good but not super pharncy.

Somewhat uneven, desultory wait service.

Meals include some good (but cold) bread, butter, a vegetarian soup, salad.

Vegetables served homestyle.

Might want to consider the lunches served border style with 50 people eating together at long tables.

Chef believes in some serious garlic.  Food with a Basque influence.

data.title: Not my kind of place
data.text:
If you miss being in the military or prison then come here. Lol. You sit next to people you don't know, have no dining options, and a strict chow time. The theme is "family style" Spanish Dining and the food served was not bad. We went for Saturday brunch.  They make really strong cocktails in the bar while you wait for the chow bell to ring. 

Brunch started with salad, then we were served an omelette that you shared with your dining neighbor.  Then came pork chops, they forgot the apple sauce but they did apologize. Wine flowed freely, as much as two bottles would get you. 

Everyone who worked there were really nice, the room was old and in need of a renovation.  I had higher expectations, so a bit disappointed.  Maybe other days are better and more enjoyable but I'm good and probably won't return.

data.title: Basque Restaurant at the Boarder's Table
data.text: We have dined here on three occasions this year, but always at the Boarder's Table rather than in the co-located restaurant area where you can order off the menu.  It is always great fun to sit at long tables with strangers sharing food, family style.  On Sunday, the Boarder's Table meal was served at 12:30 PM and was announced with the ringing of a bell.  At that time, we all entered the large dinning room.  My guess is that there were about 50 of us.  By the way, there is still one boarder, who lives upstairs, his name is Michel and he has lived here for decades.  He is an interesting guy who once served in the French Foreign Legion.  The main courses change from meal to meal.  The day we were here, we started with soup, salad, bread, blue cheese, vegetables, French fries, with two main courses:  Ox Tail stew and Rib-Eye steak with butter and garlic.  I had never tried Ox Tail stew before and found it to be flavorful and similar to osso bucco, but more chewier.  I also had two Rib-Eye steaks.  For dessert (not included), we chose almond cake with coffee (included) which was quite tasty; next time I'll try their chocolate cake which also looked very good.  All this was for $25 and includes bottles of red and rose wine which are placed every so often along the table.  During the week the price is $17.  This is a unique dinning experience worth trying.

data.title: "Not as good as it use to be"...
data.text: It's been 4 or 5 yrs since I've eaten here, and it seemed better back then. The menu offers a little of everything, and comes with soup, salad and side dishes. The lamb chops were ok, but a little chewy. The soup and salad were good. The French fries and twice baked potato were just ok. The service was good, and you won't leave hungry. Maybe I'll try it again, and order something else.

data.title: UNIQUE BASQUE FOOD
data.text:
I was surprised that restaurant was almost empty.  They have excellent Basque dishes and plenty to eat.

The meal included fresh homemade onion soup, a great salad and excellent bread.

We both had the rack of lamb which was prepared as ordered.  Excellent flavor.

Well worth out long drive.

data.title: Boarders' Table = food and new friends
data.text: I went with four friends and we chose the Boarders' Table where you sit with people you don't know, but when the dinner is over you know them quite well!  My friend and I are vegetarian, so they brought us some plain spaghetti noodles with garlic and lots of butter on them,  so they don't really have a main dish option, but the most fun were the sides.  Their version of french fries is a MOUNTAIN on a platter along with unlimited salad with a very basic dressing but good, and we had split pea soup and beans and bread.  The standouts to me were the unlimited blue cheese  and red wine. The bowls and plates get passed along the table, and everyone talks and has fun for a very reasonable price. Great way to spend an evening doing something new.

data.title: Good Basque Restaurant
data.text: We went here on a Thursday evening and were surprised to see the restaurant was fairly busy on a weeknight.  I had the Lukinka & Noodles which was really good if you like garlicky dishes.  Our meals came with soup, bread, salad, and beans.  I was disappointed they did not have paella on the menu but was told they sometimes serve this on weekends during family style banquets.  Our server was really friendly, and overall our dining experience was great.

data.title: Not basco at all
data.text:
Too expensive for what it is
Not typical food from Basque region
Service was a little hectic. There were only a handfull of tables and it felt luke they were in a hurry to close the place

data.title: Great food in a place that need remodeling.
data.text: As we arrive in the Parking Area, which was a gravel parking area, so we went around toward the front and than parked around the left side. We thought the enterance was in front and read a sign saying enter side door. We were which I guess the first customer. We were treated real nice. We made our order which I say was real good. Our waitress made us feel welcome. But the place smell old and needs remodeling. I bet if they payed attention toward the entrance and remodeled the inside this place would pop! Upon leavings get our bill was slow. So be patient in this place. Oh yes in the front is a bar. This place has lots of history but needs up dating. Otherwise as for now OK.

data.title: DIFFERENT - UNIQUE
data.text:
French Basque Dinners    Family Style.
An old fashioned, the way it was done, for generations, family owned & run. 

Bernadette Helton, the owner and manager was sooooooo gracious. What a sweet heart. The food was average, but the experience was superb. It is done family style with everyone being seated at the same time, about 12:30 PM at long tables. The way it has always been done. The bar area, the holding area, could have been in the movies, quaint, inviting and friendly.

Visit Chino, Ca &story it. Highly Recommend it that everyone should try it.

data.title: Terrible experience so uncomfortable.
data.text: When in today for the first time with it to friends, I have never been so poorly treated in a restaurant and to top it off by the manager/owner. She literally told me that I could leave and it was all because I requested to have  the sourdough bread to be warm. I would've left but I was there to gather information for an article I'm writing.I personally will never go back. Review of the food: we started with the Lukiuka & Noodles homemade basque sausage over a bed of garlic noodles, The home a sausage was very very good the noodles were cut into bite size ( a no no) and a little overcooked but the flavor was good. We order the soup they told us the soup of the day was the Manhattan clam chowder that's what they called it nothing like Manhattan clam chowder but again good flavor. I ordered the Veal Pot Rost and they were out tge time was 12:15pm the restaurant opens at 11am. I order the Lamb Roast thinthly sliced not much of the natural juice but replace it with a gravy, very homey just like the rest of the entries Talapia and Meatloaf ( very salty). I was trying to order from their daily specials. Dessert, Gateau Basque it was nice but I should've been thought out totally we had some areas they still tasted a little frozen. This is a restaurant I would've loved to have been able to visit over and over to a friends and family big crowd but with such a pompous of a owner I would never set foot in it again.
